messages.title: Fighting for their Future
messages.content: Talking about education investment and smaller class sizes.

messages.title: Fair pay for heroes
messages.content: Discussing a campaign for fair pay for troops.

messages.title: Who will put more money in YOUR pocket?
messages.content: A plan to increase the tax allowance to put £700 back into the pocket of the average worker.

messages.title: We need REAL change
messages.content: Critique of Gordon Brown and the Labour Party.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Cutting the average working person's income tax bill by £700. Doing away with tax loopholes for the rich.
Cut class sizes to just 15. Giving children more access to their teachers.

issues.economy: A plan to increase the tax allowance to put £700 back into the pocket of the average worker.
issues.education: Talking about education investment and smaller class sizes.
issues.governance: Critique of Gordon Brown and the Labour Party.

housing.content: The Lib Dems have announced a new plan to cut the tax bills of people on the average pay packet by £700 by raising the tax allowance from £6,475 to £10,000.

leaflet.personalStatement: "I will not take a second home on expenses" says David Hallas.

contactInformation.address: Tunbridge Wells Liberal Democrats FREEPOST RSBK-JXAZ-XXRZ, 309 St. John's Road, Tunbridge Wells Kent TN4 9XE.

images.caption: Nick Clegg and David Hallas discussing education policy with children.
David Hallas with military personnel, discussing fair pay.
David Hallas and Nick Clegg associated with the policy of increasing the tax allowance.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Quotes on the leaflet including critiques of the conservative party, specifically mentioning 'Key Tory MPs backed call to dismantle the NHS'.
